intro: Racosperma abbreviatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved acacia, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, pinnate leaves and yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing drought-resistant features. It plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for native wildlife. Its seeds are often used in traditional Aboriginal practices and for ornamental purposes.
